content: How can I retrieve the current user's username using Bash? Can I achieve this using the 'whoami' command?

Yes, you can retrieve the current user's username using the `whoami` command in Bash. The `whoami` command is a simple and direct way to display the username of the current user. Here's how you can use it:

```bash
whoami
```

When you run this command in your terminal, it will output the username of the user currently logged into the session.

Alternatively, you can also use the `id` command with the `-un` option to achieve the same result:

```bash
id -un
```

Both commands will give you the username of the current user running the script or command.
